articles.author: Washington Examiner
articles.title: Biden rules out pardoning himself before he leaves White House
articles.description: Biden confirmed he was considering issuing preemptive pardons in response to Trump's rhetoric.
articles.content:
President Joe Biden dismissed the idea of pardoning himself as he considers using his clemency powers to protect critics of President-elect Donald Trump, who has promised to seek revenge when he returns to the White House on Jan. 20.
“Myself? Why sho... [1583 chars]

articles.author: NBC News
articles.title: Trump makes misguided accusations about California water management amid wildfires
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump has used the devastating Los Angeles wildfires to revisit a policy disagreement with California Gov.
articles.content:
President-elect Donald Trump has used the devastating Los Angeles wildfires to revisit a policy disagreement with California Gov. Gavin Newsom, pushing a series of complaints that experts say are false or misleading.
Trump this week blamed Newsom for... [5191 chars]

articles.author: Washington Examiner
articles.title: White House mum on whether Biden would sign Laken Riley Act
articles.description: The White House may not have to adopt a position related to the bill, with Republicans more likely to hold it so Trump can put his signature on it.
articles.content:
The White House is reserving judgment regarding whether President Joe Biden would sign the Republican-proposed Laken Riley Act into law.
“The process is still playing out,” press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters Friday. “We want to evaluat... [2577 chars]

articles.author: Cable News Network
articles.title: Supreme Court to review Obamacare’s no-cost coverage of cancer screenings, heart statins and HIV drugs
articles.description: The Supreme Court said Friday it will review the constitutionality of the Affordable Care Act’s no-cost coverage mandates for certain preventive care services, putting the landmark health care law in front of the justices again just as President-elect Donald Trump – who tried to repeal the law during his first presidency – returns to the White House.
articles.content:
CNN —

articles.author: The Guardian
articles.title: Panama Canal will remain Panamanian and open to all nations, says official
articles.description: Administrator rejects Donald Trump’s claims that China controls canal or suggestion US could take it back
articles.content:
The Panama Canal will remain in Panamanian hands, and open to commerce from all countries, according to the administrator of the waterway, who rejected claims by president-elect Donald Trump that the US should take it over.
Ricaurte Vásquez denied Tr... [3091 chars]

articles.author: The Guardian
articles.title: Amazon dials back DEI programs ahead of Trump inauguration
articles.description: Online giant is among several companies ending diversity, equity and inclusion programs before Trump takes office
articles.content:
Amazon.com is winding down diversity programs ahead of Republican Donald Trump’s return to the US presidency, amid growing conservative opposition to such initiatives.
Some of biggest businesses in the US have been scaling back their diversity initia... [2561 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Greenland leader says his people don't want to be Americans amid Trump interest: "We want to be Greenlandic"
articles.description: Greenland's prime minister said he hasn't spoken to President-elect Donald Trump, but that he's open to discussions about what "unites us."
articles.content:
Trump says he won't rule out military force to take Greenland
Greenland's prime minister said Friday that the mineral-rich Arctic territory's people don't want to be Americans, but that he understands U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's interest in t... [3613 chars]

articles.author: Cable News Network
articles.title: Canada is preparing to strike back hard with retaliatory tariffs if Trump starts a trade war
articles.description: Canada is preparing to retaliate with an exhaustive list of tariffs on American goods if President-elect Trump follows through with his plans to add a steep 25% import tax on Canadian exports, people familiar with the matter told CNN. The preparations show how raising tariffs could kick off a trade war that will ultimately raise prices on a number of consumer goods.
articles.content:

articles.author: Yahoo Finance
articles.title: The Trump Organization's foreign deals pledge leaves some wiggle room
articles.description: Unlike in 2017, Trump's company is not agreeing to a blanket stop on new foreign business transactions.
articles.content:
The Trump Organization announced its ethics plan for Donald Trump's second term.
The president-elect's private company said Trump would be walled off from day-to-day duties.

articles.author: Newsweek
articles.title: Biden Extends Migrant Protection Programs Trump Promised to End
articles.description: A Trump spokesperson vowed the president-elect "will deliver," despite the outgoing administration's decision.
